metadata.title: CVE-2022-0711 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way HAProxy processed HTTP responses containing the"Set-Cookie2" header. This flaw could allow an attacker to send craftedHTTP response packets which lead to an infinite loop, eventually resultingin a denial of service condition. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0711` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.0.13-2ubuntu0.5
vim-haproxy - 2.0.13-2ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.13-2ubuntu0.5').
